title: Maybe the Blood moon game mode could use a bit larger champion pool?

embed.description: This is a W ORK I N P ROGRESS POST.] [ Status: The PBE currently still down for maintenance.] The PBE has been updated! As we continue the 7.3 PBE cycle, today's update includes: Continue reading for more information!

body:
So reading the article about Blood moon game-mode hyped me a lot, however seeing the champion pool was kinda disappointing. Champions like{{champion:114}} {{champion:39}} {{champion:59}} {{champion:11}} {{champion:76}} {{champion:56}}  {{champion:254}} {{champion:133}} {{champion:58}} {{champion:92}} {{champion:19}} {{champion:62}} {{champion:5}} were missing, and I think all of them are aggressive and assassin-like enough to find a place there. Maybe the list goes on for even longer, if we include other bursty characters. IMO a game mode with 20 champions pool is gonna become pretty boring pretty fast. What makes me think it? URF. IMO it was maybe the best game mode ever created. Was, because of all the try-hards who picked the same and the same OP champions in every game made it so boring. I have no problem with players playing to win, however a champion pool so narrow will make all the games feel the same. Maybe it will be great for  3-4 games, but after that IMO it will start feeling pretty stale. I understand why the pool is restricted, as it is "Assassin mode", however IMO there should be more "pseudo-assassins" included in the draft. Especially considering how already there are champions, who are not assassins in the mode. The list, taken from FF@20 is:
Ahri
Akali
Camille
Diana
Ekko
Elise
Evelynn
Fizz
Kassadin
Katarina
Kennen
Kha'Zix
Leblanc
Lee Sin
Pantheon
Rengar
Shaco
Talon
Yasuo
Zed 

It is just my opinion. I might be absolutely wrong, however, I might be, at least to a certain level, right. The point is to raise a discussion. So, thanks in advance for joining or reading, and best of luck on the fields of justice!
